artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sanoya Tomigorō; Carver: Shimizu Ryūzo
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 183.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 38, p. 287.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: man wearing white kimono with blue obi, crawling on ground, with numerous arrows sticking in his body, his kimono, hands, head and feet bloody; grey sculpture of standing deity, with some green spots, at left
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Carver’s seal: 柳三刀 {Ryūzo tō} | Censor seal: 卯四改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Twenty-eight Famous Sufferings (Eimei nijūhasshuku 英名二十八衆句)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Enjō Kihachirō
